instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-4924 short on ppbus, repaired and still no green light
threads.message:
820-4924 PPbus_g3h was shorted at C7900 to ground, injected power, and it heated up, under microscope it was obvious damaged,

D7005 Pin 1 -1.6v-1.7v, Pin 2 0v, pin 3 1.49v-1.6v

D7005 on diod mode Pin 2 - 0.13, Pin 3 0.33

PPBUS_G3H: 0 V
PP3V42_G3H: 0.18V
PPVRTC_G3H: 0.0V
PP5V_S5: 0.0V
PP3V3_S5: 0.0V

PM_SLP_S4: 0.0v

SMC_BC_ACOK: 0.18V


SMC_ONOFF_L: 0.18V

threads.title: 820-4924 short on ppbus, repaired and still no green light
threads.message:
Which is the resistance to ground at PPBUS_G3H and 3V42 rails now?
Also check at pin 3 of D7005.
Post Q7010 voltages.

threads.title: 820-4924 short on ppbus, repaired and still no green light
threads.message: Tried known good DC in board and OEM Chargers for sure?

threads.title: 820-4924 short on ppbus, repaired and still no green light
threads.message:
resistance to ground ppbus_g3h 0.62, 3V42  - 0.18V

Q7010 pin 2,3 - 1.8V,   Pin 5,6 1.9V, Pin 4 0.22V

Resistance to ground------------
Q7010 pin 2,3 - 75.2,   Pin 5,6 34.34, Pin 4 21.99

Known DC working, tried multiple ones

threads.title: 820-4924 short on ppbus, repaired and still no green light
threads.message:
Seems that charger detects leakage and gets blocked.

You should have aprox 68k at pin5/Q7010 to ground; the value of R7012.
Check if D7012 is open, or shorted to ground.

Q7010 last posted values are in ohms, kohms, diode mode???

threads.title: 820-4924 short on ppbus, repaired and still no green light
threads.message:
q7010 are kohms,

and D7012 is not found, could have been mis written ?

threads.title: 820-4924 short on ppbus, repaired and still no green light
threads.message: Sorry, is D7010 in this board...

threads.title: 820-4924 short on ppbus, repaired and still no green light
threads.message: problem was D7010, it was a bit damaged for some reason, so im guessing it was not opening, another sucessful repair, thank you guys so much, specially you 2informaticos!!
